Class UserPlaneTest

java.lang.Object
Plane.UserPlaneTest
public class UserPlaneTest extends Object
Unit tests for the UserPlane class.

This test suite verifies the functionality of the UserPlane class, including movement, health management, kill count tracking, and the singleton pattern implementation. The tests ensure that the methods of UserPlane behave as expected.

Source Code: GitHub Link

      private UserPlane userPlane
      The UserPlane instance used in the tests.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserPlaneTest

      public UserPlaneTest()

  • Method Details

    • setupJavaFX

      public static void setupJavaFX()
      Ensures that the JavaFX platform is initialized before running tests.

      This is necessary to test JavaFX-related methods in the UserPlane class.

    • setUp

      public void setUp()
      Sets up the test environment before each test.

      Initializes a new UserPlane instance with a default health value.

    • testGetUserPlane

      public void testGetUserPlane()
      Tests the singleton pattern implementation in UserPlane.

      Verifies that multiple calls to UserPlane.getUserPlane() return the same instance.

    • testResetPosition

      public void testResetPosition()
      Tests the `ResetPosition` method of UserPlane.

      Verifies that the position of the plane is reset to its initial values.

    • testResetHealth

      public void testResetHealth()
      Tests the `ResetHealth` method of UserPlane.

      Verifies that the health of the plane is reset to its initial value, and the plane is not destroyed.

    • testFireProjectile

      public void testFireProjectile()
      Placeholder test for the `fireProjectile` method.

      Verifies that a projectile is created and initialized with the correct position. Currently commented out because the method is not fully implemented in the codebase.

    • testHorizontalMoving

      public void testHorizontalMoving()
      Tests the horizontal movement of the UserPlane.

      Verifies that calling `moveLeft` sets the plane to horizontal moving mode and calling `Horizontalstop` stops horizontal movement.

    • testVerticalMoving

      public void testVerticalMoving()
      Tests the vertical movement of the UserPlane.

      Verifies that calling `moveUp` sets the plane to vertical moving mode and calling `Verticalstop` stops vertical movement.

    • testSetNumberOfKills

      public void testSetNumberOfKills()
      Tests the `setNumberOfKills` method.

      Verifies that the kill count of the UserPlane is correctly updated.

    • testIncrementKillCount

      public void testIncrementKillCount()
      Tests the `incrementKillCount` method.

      Verifies that the kill count of the UserPlane is correctly incremented.
